Everyone, red and blue, is tuned in to see how this ends. One side dreading a potentially disastrous outcome, while the other watches its archrival suffer, hoping for the absolute worst. 
Me, Iâ€™m enjoying the hell out of it. Canâ€™t thank the universe enough for wrapping this gift and delivering it to my doorstep last Friday. Like everyone else, Iâ€™m devouring handfuls of popcorn with all eyes glued to the situation, rooting for Louisvilleâ€™s demise. But as I wait for it all to play out, I have so many questions about the whole thing. Iâ€™m throwing them all out there tonightâ€¦ 

Youâ€™re a star basketball player. Why hookers?

Walk-ons get boy band ass when theyâ€™re a member of a top 10 basketball program. There are jersey chasers everywhere and theyâ€™re very good at doing just that: chasing jerseys. The whole point of their existence is they come to you, hence the â€œchase.â€ Minimal effort to get them home for a night. Itâ€™s a great deal for athletes. Itâ€™s unfair to the rest of us, really.

So letâ€™s say nightwalkers are your thing. Sounds to me like a real waste of money. You had one job! 
What kind of a sick human being pimps out her own teenage daughters? 
While I find humor in 99. percent of this whole scandal, the mother-daughter prostitution ring is terribly sad.

Did Rick Pitino know it was happening? 
Ah, the million dollar question: Did Rick Pitino know? 
The madam says yes, Pitino knew. She claims Andre McGee told her, â€œRick knows about everything.â€

Will the 2013 title banner come down? 
Unlikely.
